		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>
				<div id='quickcomment_{{comment.objecttype}}_{{comment.objectid}}_{{comment.commentid}}'></div>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="comment_toolbar" ng-show="showpager||numnextitems_calculated">
			<span
				ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numnextitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 additional comment',
					        'other': '{} additional comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('next')">View More Comments {{limitCount(numnextitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}&nbsp;/&nbsp;{{numnextitems_calculated}}</span>

			<span class="fr"
				  ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>
			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>
	
</div>

	</div>

	<div style='position:absolute;  z-index:2000;' id='recsure_geeklist224225'></div></div>
			I try to make one of these every year.<br /><br />This is really a snapshot in time. The highest ranked games rarely change.  The others may go up and down based on how I recently I played them.  There are games I like a lot that aren't on here because they haven't been on the table for awhile or I need to explore them more deeply.<br /><br />Probably no surprise, but the majority of my gaming is solo wargaming.  I also play Euros and fillers with the family and Ameritrash with a buddy in town.<br /><br />Solitaire-only games rated more highly than normal because I just come off of my periodic <a href="https://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/232121/barteus-con-2017-convention-rest-us" target="_blank" class="postlink" rel="nofollow">30 solitaire games in 30 days challenge (Barteus Con)</a>.<br /><br />I also have an ongoing <a href="https://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/226870/my-personal-top-10s" target="_blank" class="postlink" rel="nofollow">Top 10 lists</a> of various categories that I am always adding on to as I play through more of my collection and re-visit it.<br /><br />Comments are welcome. <br /><br /><div ><a href="/image/3290935"><img src="https://cf.geekdo-images.com/images/pic3290935_md.png" onload="ImageResizer.resize(this);"></a></div>

				<div><a href="/user/airjudden"><img
				class='js-overtext' 
				data-overtexttype='avatarovertext'
				width="64" 
				height="64"
				src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="

				data-frz-src="https://cf.geekdo-static.com/avatars/avatar_id107791.png"
				alt="Avatar"></a>
		</div>
	
		
			<div class='badgeyears'>
	<a href="/support"  class='js_badgelink'
		onmouseover="GAV_ShowBadge( this ); return overlib( 'This user supports the website - Click for more info.', WRAP );"
		onmouseout="return nd();">
	<span class='oddicon patron'></span><span class='oddicon year_10_band band' data-year='10'></span><span class='oddicon year_11_band band' data-year='11'></span><span class='oddicon year_12_band band' data-year='12'></span><span class='oddicon year_13_band band' data-year='13'></span><span class='oddicon year_14_num num last' data-year='14'></span>	</a>
</div>
		
	<div ><a href="/microbadge/1224"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Kansas State University', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_1224_0.gif"></a><a href="/microbadge/14733"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Washington\&#039;s War fan ', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_14733_1.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/38935"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('&quot;I am not throwing away my shot!&quot;', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_38935_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/29834"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Mark Herman fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_29834_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/32496"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Michael Rinella Fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_32496_0.png"></a></div>
</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#75</span><br /><br />Another family favorite.  This is my favorite Ticket to Ride variant from the first few that came out. I haven't played any since Macklin. The train stations and tunnels were a great idea.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: Not Ranked</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl>

		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">

						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">

					</dd>
				</dl>

					<dd class="left">

					</dd>

						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">

								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]

						</ul>

							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>

			<dt class='recs'><a href="/login">6</a>&nbsp;</dt>
	<dd class='thumbdd'><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class="icon " src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==" alt="Thumb up" title="Thumb up"></a></dd>

			<dt class='tippers'><a href="/login" style='color: #969600;'></a></dt>
	<dd><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class='icon i_coinsmall2' title='GeekGold Tip' alt='tip' style=''  src='data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==' /></a></dd> 
			<dt class='thumbsdown'></dt>
	<dd><a href="/login" onmouseover="return overlib('Hide/Report this post', WRAP);" onmouseout="return nd();">&nbsp;<img class='icon i_redsquarex' title='Hide' alt='Hide' style=''  src='data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==' /></a></dd>
	</dl>
<div style='position:absolute;  z-index:2000;' id='recsure_listitem5334590'></div>						
</div>
								</dd>
						<dd class="doublecommands">
				<ul>
										<li id='recommendstatus_listitem5334590'>

		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>
				<div id='quickcomment_{{comment.objecttype}}_{{comment.objectid}}_{{comment.commentid}}'></div>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="comment_toolbar" ng-show="showpager||numnextitems_calculated">

				ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"

			</a>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#72</span><br /><br />One of my favorite Euro/fillers because it involves dice and conflict to go with your tableau management.  It's Stephen Feld, and I guess that means something to a lot of folks.  I never heard of him until this, and I was hoping he made more games like this (besides <a  href="/boardgame/16496/roma"   >Roma</a>), with conflict and dice and such, but it sounds like this is not the case.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #76</b>

	  data-ng-init='init({"objecttype":"listitem","objectid":5334580,"disallowcomments":false,"showcount":50,"commentid":0,"showeditcontrols":0,"showadmincontrols":0,"showdeletecontrols":0,"viewdate":false,"events":[],"hidecomments":false,"numitems":"0","endpage":0,"direction":"previous","inclusive":true,"showmore":true}, {&quot;config&quot;:{&quot;locked&quot;:0,&quot;objectlink&quot;:&quot;&lt;a  href=\&quot;\/boardgame\/56931\/arena-roma-ii\&quot;   &gt;Arena: Roma II&lt;\/a&gt; &amp;raquo; &lt;a  href=\&quot;\/geeklist\/224225\/item\/5334580#item5334580\&quot;   &gt;Item for Geeklist \&quot;Airjudden&#039;s Top 100: 2017\&quot; &lt;\/a&gt;&quot;,&quot;current_userid&quot;:null,&quot;numitems&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;numprevitems&quot;:0},&quot;comments&quot;:[]})'>
	
		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#70</span><br /><br />The Civil War in a deck of cards: inconceivable!  Yet it works.  It has a few shortcomings: namely in the way you are the mercy of the deck distribution and the die roll combat can create some swingy results, providing a higher percentage of games outside of the norm, but it more than makes up for an innovative design -- one of the most amazing ever -- and when you do get the "normal" games, which is still a significant occurrence: it <i>really</i> works.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #47</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>

		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>
				<div id='quickcomment_{{comment.objecttype}}_{{comment.objectid}}_{{comment.commentid}}'></div>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="comment_toolbar" ng-show="showpager||numnextitems_calculated">
			<span
				ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numnextitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 additional comment',
					        'other': '{} additional comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('next')">View More Comments {{limitCount(numnextitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}&nbsp;/&nbsp;{{numnextitems_calculated}}</span>

			<span class="fr"
				  ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#69</span><br /><br />One of the finest block games, if not finest wargames ever made.  The only downside is the significant playing time that goes into a scenario and the near-impossibility of actually pulling off the campaign, makes it tough to get to the table.<br /><br />Columbia needs more games like this and less games based on <a  href="/boardgame/3685/hammer-scots"   >Hammer of the Scots</a>, not that Hammer is not a fine game, but this one is so much more!<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #57</b>

		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>
				<div id='quickcomment_{{comment.objecttype}}_{{comment.objectid}}_{{comment.commentid}}'></div>
			</div>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#68</span><br /><br />Outside of <a  href="/boardgame/37836/julius-caesar"   >Julius Caesar</a>, I find the <a  href="/boardgame/3685/hammer-scots"   >Hammer of the Scots</a> template overused and frankly, a bit pasted on.  This game uses that foundation, but differs enough that this is how the Hammer clones SHOULD have approached the template.  This one uses one less round of combat and a better card system, which allows you to manage a hand rather than curse the random distribution of the deck.  Additionally, it uses asymmetrical forces in strength while the stronger side is racing the timer: while it is not new to wargaming, it is pretty novel for the Hammer family.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #56</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>

				class="supergeekbadge js-overtext"
		   	data-overtexttype = 'badgeovertext'
		   	src="https://cf.geekdo-static.com/tmpbadgeimage/badge_a0bbe6a64ae2facaa04e4ea12a128d40.png"></a>
	</div>
		
						<div class='dn js-avatarovertext'>&quot;Just get that sucka to the designated place at the designated time and I will gladly designate his ass...for dismemberment!&quot; - Sho Nuff.</div>
				<div><a href="/user/airjudden"><img
				class='js-overtext' 
				data-overtexttype='avatarovertext'
				width="64" 
				height="64"
				src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="

		</div>
	
		
			<div class='badgeyears'>
	<a href="/support"  class='js_badgelink'
		onmouseover="GAV_ShowBadge( this ); return overlib( 'This user supports the website - Click for more info.', WRAP );"
		onmouseout="return nd();">
	<span class='oddicon patron'></span><span class='oddicon year_10_band band' data-year='10'></span><span class='oddicon year_11_band band' data-year='11'></span><span class='oddicon year_12_band band' data-year='12'></span><span class='oddicon year_13_band band' data-year='13'></span><span class='oddicon year_14_num num last' data-year='14'></span>	</a>
</div>
		
	<div ><a href="/microbadge/1224"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Kansas State University', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_1224_0.gif"></a><a href="/microbadge/14733"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Washington\&#039;s War fan ', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_14733_1.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/38935"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('&quot;I am not throwing away my shot!&quot;', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_38935_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/29834"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Mark Herman fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_29834_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/32496"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Michael Rinella Fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_32496_0.png"></a></div>
</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#67</span><br /><br />This game kind of killed <a  href="/boardgame/12333/twilight-struggle"   >Twilight Struggle</a> for me, but mainly because it is a quick game but still captures the essence of spreading political influence while trying to avoid nuclear war.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #37</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>
		</dl>

		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">

								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">

							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>
				<div id='quickcomment_{{comment.objecttype}}_{{comment.objectid}}_{{comment.commentid}}'></div>
			</div>
		</div>

	<div ><a href="/microbadge/1224"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Kansas State University', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_1224_0.gif"></a><a href="/microbadge/14733"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Washington\&#039;s War fan ', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_14733_1.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/38935"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('&quot;I am not throwing away my shot!&quot;', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_38935_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/29834"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Mark Herman fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_29834_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/32496"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Michael Rinella Fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_32496_0.png"></a></div>
</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#66</span><br /><br />This has spent too many years under the radar when it should be hailed as a classic.  I have yet to see a Civil War game of this scale get so much of the Civil War correct, especially the cavalry.  As far as capturing Lee's campaign, this one put you squarely in the saddle of Lee & Meade: <br />What is Bobby Lee up to?<br />Where is JEB?  Where are those Yanks?<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #60</b>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#65</span><br /><br />Cthulhu isn't really my thing.  I know that is weird since I'm into Ameritrash, but I prefer a zombie, gene steeler, or dinosaur.  As a result, I am very "meh" to <a  href="/boardgame/15987/arkham-horror"   >Arkham Horror</a> while acknowledging the greatness of the game in regards to the industry.<br /><br />That said, this game rocks.  It is stripped down enough to capture my interest and doesn't have that bloated feeling that Arkham has, although I'm sure FFG will add enough expansions (if they haven't already) to bog this one down.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #43</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>

									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#64</span><br /><br />This is a game I do not own (too much money for too little game) but would be glad to play.  Yeah, the dogfighting violates every law of physics -- such is the way of Star Wars.  But this is the dogfighting system I most enjoy.  Giving the pilots specialized abilities is the cherry on the sundae.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #71</b>

		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>
				<div id='quickcomment_{{comment.objecttype}}_{{comment.objectid}}_{{comment.commentid}}'></div>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="comment_toolbar" ng-show="showpager||numnextitems_calculated">
			<span
				ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numnextitems_calculated"

				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

					ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"

				  ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>

</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#62</span><br /><br />One of my favorite Eurogames. It has power plants, electricity, and Uranium: what's not to love?  This is a big hit in my house. I like the horserace-like aspect: stay in the pack and break at the end -- don't get too far ahead early.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #51</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl>
							<dd class="doubleleft">
									<div id='recommendstatus_listitem5334617'>
	<dl class="recommend">
			<dt class='recs'><a href="/login">17</a>&nbsp;</dt>
	<dd class='thumbdd'><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class="icon " src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==" alt="Thumb up" title="Thumb up"></a></dd>

			<dt class='tippers'><a href="/login" style='color: #969600;'></a></dt>
	<dd><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class='icon i_coinsmall2' title='GeekGold Tip' alt='tip' style=''  src='data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==' /></a></dd> 
			<dt class='thumbsdown'></dt>
	<dd><a href="/login" onmouseover="return overlib('Hide/Report this post', WRAP);" onmouseout="return nd();">&nbsp;<img class='icon i_redsquarex' title='Hide' alt='Hide' style=''  src='data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==' /></a></dd>
	</dl>
<div style='position:absolute;  z-index:2000;' id='recsure_listitem5334617'></div>						
</div>
								</dd>
						<dd class="doublecommands">
				<ul>
										<li id='recommendstatus_listitem5334617'>
											</li>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',

				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>

		</div>

		</div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"

							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#60</span><br /><br />My love for this game wanes with time. It is important to the history of wargaming, but the length of the game and the amount of scripting that occurs keeps it off the table. How often does Russia capitulate and/or America join the allies? It doesn't seem like much because the scripting is insane, and that is a real problem for me. It seems like there would be a fan-created solution to this.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #36</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>

		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>

				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>

					<dd class="left">

							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>

					</dd>

					<dd class="left">

								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>

						</ul>

							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>

							</li>
						</ul>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#59</span><br /><br />A great look at one of the most important battles in history. In many ways, this feels like the best application of the <a  href="/boardgamefamily/54/battles-american-revolution"   >Battles of the American Revolution</a> system because it was designed for this battle and forced on to the others (ex: <a  href="/boardgame/7086/guilford"   >Guilford</a> is a major fail since the militia tactics changed between 1777 and 1781).  This has less replayability than some of the other games in the system, but still provides a lot of punch in those few games.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: Not Ranked</b>

									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>

This one also has a tableau, like <a  href="/boardgame/41627/zulus-ramparts"   >Zulus on the Ramparts!</a> but this one involves leadership and number of regiments involved in each battle (as well as supplemental units and characteristics) and healthy amounts of dice chucking in each combat.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #66</b>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#55</span><br /><br />One of the heavier State of Siege games with a GREAT combat system and numerous improvements to the base system, such as opposing resource tracks, victory point cards that can be bought if criteria are met, and fortresses whose control are vital because each one supplies an action point each turn, as well as an option to play 3 shorter scenarios or a linked campaign.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #70</b>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#54</span><br /><br />I like my Euros a bit bigger than fluff and a bit old school (for a Euro).  I especially like them if they have George Washington in them!<br /><br />This one is about the Constitutional Convention of 1787. The victory premise is a bit absurd but the means to get there (votes, debates, and back room deals) are not.<br /><br />Did I mention that George Washington is in this game?<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #46</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>

				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>

										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>

			</div>
		</div>

			<span
				ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numnextitems_calculated"

			</span>

				  ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>

									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#53</span><br /><br />This game is really fun.  It's not a hard core simulation and it is not trying to be, but the lines tend to end up forming in their historical locations.<br /><br />The magic in this one is in the mechanics.  It models command and control difficulties in an abstract, yet unique way that creates a new layer of challenge for the player and makes you think about wargaming in a way not handled before.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #38</b>

		<span class='js-avatarmenu' style='position:absolute; z-index:300;'></span>
	</div>
			
	
		
		
	
		
			
	
		<div>
					<div class='dn js-badgeovertext'>Every Man a (K-State) Wildcat!</div>
			   <a href="/user/airjudden"><img alt='badge' title=''
				class="supergeekbadge js-overtext"
		   	data-overtexttype = 'badgeovertext'
		   	src="https://cf.geekdo-static.com/tmpbadgeimage/badge_a0bbe6a64ae2facaa04e4ea12a128d40.png"></a>
	</div>
		
						<div class='dn js-avatarovertext'>&quot;Just get that sucka to the designated place at the designated time and I will gladly designate his ass...for dismemberment!&quot; - Sho Nuff.</div>
				<div><a href="/user/airjudden"><img
				class='js-overtext' 
				data-overtexttype='avatarovertext'
				width="64" 
				height="64"
				src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="
				onload="lzld(this)"
				onerror="lzld(this)"
				data-frz-src="https://cf.geekdo-static.com/avatars/avatar_id107791.png"
				alt="Avatar"></a>
		</div>
	
		
			<div class='badgeyears'>
	<a href="/support"  class='js_badgelink'
		onmouseover="GAV_ShowBadge( this ); return overlib( 'This user supports the website - Click for more info.', WRAP );"
		onmouseout="return nd();">
	<span class='oddicon patron'></span><span class='oddicon year_10_band band' data-year='10'></span><span class='oddicon year_11_band band' data-year='11'></span><span class='oddicon year_12_band band' data-year='12'></span><span class='oddicon year_13_band band' data-year='13'></span><span class='oddicon year_14_num num last' data-year='14'></span>	</a>
</div>
		
	<div ><a href="/microbadge/1224"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Kansas State University', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_1224_0.gif"></a><a href="/microbadge/14733"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Washington\&#039;s War fan ', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_14733_1.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/38935"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('&quot;I am not throwing away my shot!&quot;', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_38935_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/29834"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Mark Herman fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_29834_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/32496"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Michael Rinella Fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_32496_0.png"></a></div>
</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#51</span><br /><br />Dinosaurs make EVERYTHING better. This is a case in point. If this weren't dinosaurs, I doubt I would like -- ergo, the lack of bidding games on this list.  This has bidding for evolutionary traits, maneuvering dinosaurs to more favorable climates, reproducing, battling, and dying.  It has conflict and randomness (when will the world come to an end?) ... and dinosaurs!<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #41</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl>
							<dd class="doubleleft">
