	  data-ng-init='init({"objecttype":"listitem","objectid":5756255,"disallowcomments":false,"showcount":50,"commentid":0,"showeditcontrols":0,"showadmincontrols":0,"showdeletecontrols":0,"viewdate":false,"events":[],"hidecomments":false,"numitems":"0","endpage":0,"direction":"previous","inclusive":true,"showmore":true}, {&quot;config&quot;:{&quot;locked&quot;:0,&quot;objectlink&quot;:&quot;&lt;a  href=\&quot;\/boardgame\/8461\/first-team-vietnam\&quot;   &gt;First Team: Vietnam&lt;\/a&gt; &amp;raquo; &lt;a  href=\&quot;\/geeklist\/224225\/item\/5756255#item5756255\&quot;   &gt;Item for Geeklist \&quot;Airjudden&#039;s Top 100: 2017\&quot; &lt;\/a&gt;&quot;,&quot;current_userid&quot;:null,&quot;numitems&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;numprevitems&quot;:0},&quot;comments&quot;:[]})'>
	
		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>
				<div id='quickcomment_{{comment.objecttype}}_{{comment.objectid}}_{{comment.commentid}}'></div>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="comment_toolbar" ng-show="showpager||numnextitems_calculated">
			<span
				ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numnextitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 additional comment',
					        'other': '{} additional comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

					ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"

			<span class="fr"
				  ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#26</span><br /><br />One of my favorite Area-Impulse games. It's a tight and asymmetrical game. The Confederates have the terrain on their side, but they have to react quickly to the threat from the overwhelming forces to keep the Union from breaking through to Richmond. A unique mechanic involving leaders combine the operational level system (ex: <a  href="/boardgame/730/breakout-normandy"   >Breakout: Normandy</a>) and the tactical level (a.k.a. <a  href="/boardgame/1423/storm-over-arnhem"   >Storm over Arnhem</a>) system where a unit flips over after activating.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #24</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>

							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>
				<div id='quickcomment_{{comment.objecttype}}_{{comment.objectid}}_{{comment.commentid}}'></div>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="comment_toolbar" ng-show="showpager||numnextitems_calculated">
			<span
				ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numnextitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 additional comment',
					        'other': '{} additional comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('next')">View More Comments {{limitCount(numnextitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}&nbsp;/&nbsp;{{numnextitems_calculated}}</span>

			<span class="fr"
				  ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>
			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>
	
</div>

	</div>

		</div>
	
		<div class='pager'><a href="/geeklist/224225/airjuddens-top-100-2017/page/2?" target='_self' title="previous page"><b>Prev &laquo;</b></a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="/geeklist/224225/airjuddens-top-100-2017/page/1?" target='_self' title="page 1">1</a>&nbsp;,&nbsp;<a href="/geeklist/224225/airjuddens-top-100-2017/page/2?" target='_self' title="page 2">2</a>&nbsp;,&nbsp;<b>3</b>&nbsp;,&nbsp;<a href="/geeklist/224225/airjuddens-top-100-2017/page/4?" target='_self' title="page 4">4</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="/geeklist/224225/airjuddens-top-100-2017/page/4?" target='_self' title="next page"><b>Next &raquo;</b></a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class='dull'>|</span>&nbsp;</div>

			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',

				</ng-pluralize>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>
				<div id='quickcomment_{{comment.objecttype}}_{{comment.objectid}}_{{comment.commentid}}'></div>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="comment_toolbar" ng-show="showpager||numnextitems_calculated">
			<span
				ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numnextitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 additional comment',
					        'other': '{} additional comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('next')">View More Comments {{limitCount(numnextitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}&nbsp;/&nbsp;{{numnextitems_calculated}}</span>

			<span class="fr"
				  ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>
			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>
	
</div>

	</div>

	<div class='recommendbox_str'>Recommend</div>
	<dl class="recommend">
			<dt class='recsbig'><a href="/login">110</a>&nbsp;</dt>
	<dd class='thumbdd'><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class="icon " src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==" alt="Thumb up" title="Thumb up"></a></dd>

	</dl>
			<dl class="recommend">
				<dt class='tippersbig'><a href="/login" style='color: #969600;'>18.37</a></dt>
	<dd><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class='icon i_coinsmall2' title='GeekGold Tip' alt='tip' style=''  src='data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==' /></a></dd> 
				<dt class='thumbsdown'></dt>
	<dd><a href="/login" onmouseover="return overlib('Flag this GeekList', WRAP);" onmouseout="return nd();">&nbsp;<img class='icon i_redsquarex' title='Hide' alt='Hide' style=''  src='data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==' /></a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div class="clear"></div>
	</div>
	<div style='position:absolute;  z-index:2000;' id='recsure_geeklist224225'></div></div>
			I try to make one of these every year.<br /><br />This is really a snapshot in time. The highest ranked games rarely change.  The others may go up and down based on how I recently I played them.  There are games I like a lot that aren't on here because they haven't been on the table for awhile or I need to explore them more deeply.<br /><br />Probably no surprise, but the majority of my gaming is solo wargaming.  I also play Euros and fillers with the family and Ameritrash with a buddy in town.<br /><br />Solitaire-only games rated more highly than normal because I just come off of my periodic <a href="https://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/232121/barteus-con-2017-convention-rest-us" target="_blank" class="postlink" rel="nofollow">30 solitaire games in 30 days challenge (Barteus Con)</a>.<br /><br />I also have an ongoing <a href="https://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/226870/my-personal-top-10s" target="_blank" class="postlink" rel="nofollow">Top 10 lists</a> of various categories that I am always adding on to as I play through more of my collection and re-visit it.<br /><br />Comments are welcome. <br /><br /><div ><a href="/image/3290935"><img src="https://cf.geekdo-images.com/images/pic3290935_md.png" onload="ImageResizer.resize(this);"></a></div>

									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#25</span><br /><br />This is the biggest, most complex block game I have come across.  It covers a huge theater with many excellent mechanics covering replacing step losses and Japanese supply as well as combining operational combat with strategic level wargaming.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #21</b>

							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>
				<div id='quickcomment_{{comment.objecttype}}_{{comment.objectid}}_{{comment.commentid}}'></div>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="comment_toolbar" ng-show="showpager||numnextitems_calculated">
			<span
				ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numnextitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 additional comment',
					        'other': '{} additional comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('next')">View More Comments {{limitCount(numnextitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}&nbsp;/&nbsp;{{numnextitems_calculated}}</span>

			<span class="fr"
				  ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

		</div>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#24</span><br /><br />Once upon a time, zombie games sucked.  Then a man name Hermann Luttmann showed the world how to make a zombie game.  He inspired people to make good zombie games.  But still, nobody has come close to topping Mr. Luttmann's undead baby.<br /><br />This is State of Siege at its finest.  It drips with theme and narrative and has near endless possibilities.<br /><br /><br /><b>Last Year: #35</b>

		   	src="https://cf.geekdo-static.com/tmpbadgeimage/badge_a0bbe6a64ae2facaa04e4ea12a128d40.png"></a>
	</div>
		
						<div class='dn js-avatarovertext'>&quot;Just get that sucka to the designated place at the designated time and I will gladly designate his ass...for dismemberment!&quot; - Sho Nuff.</div>
				<div><a href="/user/airjudden"><img
				class='js-overtext' 
				data-overtexttype='avatarovertext'
				width="64"

				data-frz-src="https://cf.geekdo-static.com/avatars/avatar_id107791.png"
				alt="Avatar"></a>
		</div>
	
		
			<div class='badgeyears'>
	<a href="/support"  class='js_badgelink'
		onmouseover="GAV_ShowBadge( this ); return overlib( 'This user supports the website - Click for more info.', WRAP );"
		onmouseout="return nd();">
	<span class='oddicon patron'></span><span class='oddicon year_10_band band' data-year='10'></span><span class='oddicon year_11_band band' data-year='11'></span><span class='oddicon year_12_band band' data-year='12'></span><span class='oddicon year_13_band band' data-year='13'></span><span class='oddicon year_14_num num last' data-year='14'></span>	</a>
</div>
		
	<div ><a href="/microbadge/1224"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Kansas State University', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_1224_0.gif"></a><a href="/microbadge/14733"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Washington\&#039;s War fan ', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_14733_1.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/38935"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('&quot;I am not throwing away my shot!&quot;', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_38935_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/29834"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Mark Herman fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_29834_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/32496"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Michael Rinella Fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_32496_0.png"></a></div>
</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#23</span><br /><br />My favorite Vietnam game and an excellent application of the Mark Herman-style Card Driven Game system.  This one gives you operation points every time you play a card and you can spend them to move, fight, buy events, and even bank them to prop up the SVN government.<br /><br />The game also offers set up and victory conditions for each year, allowing you to start any year and ending on that year or any subsequent year, so you can shorten your game if required.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #19</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl>

					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>

			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="comment_toolbar" ng-show="showpager||numnextitems_calculated">
			<span
				ng-show="numnextitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>

					ng-click="loadMoreComments('next')">View More Comments {{limitCount(numnextitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}&nbsp;/&nbsp;{{numnextitems_calculated}}</span>

				  ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>

		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>
				<div id='quickcomment_{{comment.objecttype}}_{{comment.objectid}}_{{comment.commentid}}'></div>
			</div>
		</div>

		<div class="comment_toolbar" ng-show="showpager||numnextitems_calculated">
			<span

</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#21</span><br /><br />After all of these years, I still love this game.  I haven't played it enough to do ... you know what.  So I still find a lot of variety and fun in the strategies and the concept of deckbuilding in this theater was a brilliant move.  This is exactly what I like about Martin Wallace's wargames: they introduce some Euro-like element into the game that you don't see every day and makes them a fresh look.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #17</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#20</span><br /><br />This is one of my all-time favorites.  I have played every scenario multiple times.  This Action Point system is a vast improvement over Richard Borg's Command & Colors system.  You are not paralyzed by not having the right card, but you may not have enough points to carry out what you want to do.<br /><br />Added bonus is the extremely high quality of the game.  Another bonus: I can play it on my phone.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #14</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>

	<div ><a href="/microbadge/1224"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Kansas State University', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_1224_0.gif"></a><a href="/microbadge/14733"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Washington\&#039;s War fan ', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_14733_1.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/38935"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('&quot;I am not throwing away my shot!&quot;', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_38935_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/29834"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Mark Herman fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_29834_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/32496"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Michael Rinella Fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_32496_0.png"></a></div>

</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#19</span><br /><br />As a topic, I much prefer the American Revolution.  As a game, I much prefer this.  This game takes the <a  href="/boardgame/35342/hold-line"   >Hold the Line</a> system and enhances it.  You can bank action points over to another turn, based on your leadership rating.  Cavalry charges are much more devastating, and the scenarios are much more balanced: both sides do not need the same number of victory points to win the scenario.  This game has a lot of scenarios and even MORE fan-created scenarios.  It has that kind of following.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #13</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl>
							<dd class="doubleleft">
									<div id='recommendstatus_listitem5334660'>
	<dl class="recommend">
			<dt class='recs'><a href="/login">5</a>&nbsp;</dt>
	<dd class='thumbdd'><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class="icon " src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==" alt="Thumb up" title="Thumb up"></a></dd>

			<dt class='tippers'><a href="/login" style='color: #969600;'></a></dt>
	<dd><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class='icon i_coinsmall2' title='GeekGold Tip' alt='tip' style=''  src='data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==' /></a></dd> 
			<dt class='thumbsdown'></dt>
	<dd><a href="/login" onmouseover="return overlib('Hide/Report this post', WRAP);" onmouseout="return nd();">&nbsp;<img class='icon i_redsquarex' title='Hide' alt='Hide' style=''  src='data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==' /></a></dd>
	</dl>
<div style='position:absolute;  z-index:2000;' id='recsure_listitem5334660'></div>						
</div>

				<ul>
										<li id='recommendstatus_listitem5334660'>
											</li>

				  ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>

	<div ><a href="/microbadge/1224"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Kansas State University', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_1224_0.gif"></a><a href="/microbadge/14733"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Washington\&#039;s War fan ', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_14733_1.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/38935"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('&quot;I am not throwing away my shot!&quot;', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_38935_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/29834"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Mark Herman fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_29834_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/32496"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Michael Rinella Fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_32496_0.png"></a></div>
</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#18</span><br /><br />If ever there was a "hidden gem" this is it.  If you are a blockhead (a phrase I use for block game fans), this is the game to play.  It uses PARTS of the <a  href="/boardgame/3685/hammer-scots"   >Hammer of the Scots</a> system and then enhances it with superior card play that resembles a Mark Herman-inspired Card Driven game (cards in this game can have 4 different uses), a supply track that governs Roman wintering, replenishment, and force marching and results in a metagame of raiding and resupplying.  And better yet, tribe blocks have 3 directions: it faces the side it belongs to or if neutral goes face down (and comes up at full strength when it joins a side).<br /><br />The sides are asymmetrical and the game is a tight challenge.  This game inspired me to learn how to make Vassal modules so that I could play others.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #12</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>

	<div ><a href="/microbadge/1224"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Kansas State University', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_1224_0.gif"></a><a href="/microbadge/14733"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Washington\&#039;s War fan ', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_14733_1.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/38935"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('&quot;I am not throwing away my shot!&quot;', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_38935_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/29834"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Mark Herman fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_29834_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/32496"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Michael Rinella Fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_32496_0.png"></a></div>
</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#17</span><br /><br />My favorite WWII/Pacific Theater/Operational game. It is card assisted and an outlier game can hose you on rare occasions, but overall, it is an innovative system using bluffing elements and a "you got to see it to believe it" combat system and a strong emphasis on managing supply with a low overhead of rules.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #7</b>

	<div ><a href="/microbadge/1224"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Kansas State University', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_1224_0.gif"></a><a href="/microbadge/14733"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Washington\&#039;s War fan ', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_14733_1.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/38935"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('&quot;I am not throwing away my shot!&quot;', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_38935_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/29834"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Mark Herman fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_29834_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/32496"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Michael Rinella Fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_32496_0.png"></a></div>
</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#16</span><br /><br />Mechanically, I think <a  href="/boardgame/14105/commands-colors-ancients"   >Ancients</a> and <a  href="/boardgame/62222/commands-colors-napoleonics"   >Napoleonics</a> are stronger offerings, but this has George Washington in it.  That means that thematically, the only way you to improve this game is to open the box and have Mark Herman pop out riding a velociraptor firing a plasma gun at a zombie.<br /><br />And believe it or not, the mechanics fit the history well.  These battles were low casualty affairs where you were more worried about units fleeing than dying and this game manages to capture that.  Bravo!<br /><br /><b>Last Year: Not Ranked</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl>
							<dd class="doubleleft">
									<div id='recommendstatus_listitem5678922'>
	<dl class="recommend">
			<dt class='recs'><a href="/login">6</a>&nbsp;</dt>
	<dd class='thumbdd'><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class="icon " src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==" alt="Thumb up" title="Thumb up"></a></dd>

			<dt class='tippers'><a href="/login" style='color: #969600;'></a></dt>

	<div ><a href="/microbadge/1224"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Kansas State University', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_1224_0.gif"></a><a href="/microbadge/14733"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Washington\&#039;s War fan ', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_14733_1.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/38935"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('&quot;I am not throwing away my shot!&quot;', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_38935_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/29834"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Mark Herman fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_29834_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/32496"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Michael Rinella Fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_32496_0.png"></a></div>
</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#15</span><br /><br />This is way higher than any Euro has ever placed in my top 100.<br /><br />I first played this in 2009, before the game was even released to the general public.  One of the guys in our gaming group was on the Martin Wallace subscription.  I really liked the game, and would have bought it then, but it took awhile to get to the general public.  Then, I was so steeped in wargames, I never bought it.  Well, I finally got it last year, taught it to my wife and a buddy, and we all had a grand time with it.<br /><br />I love Martin Wallace's war games, but haven't had that love for his Eurogames, except for this one. This is exceptional.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: Not Ranked</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>

				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>

			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>

				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;

					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">

							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			</span>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>

										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>

	<div ><a href="/microbadge/1224"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Kansas State University', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_1224_0.gif"></a><a href="/microbadge/14733"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Washington\&#039;s War fan ', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_14733_1.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/38935"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('&quot;I am not throwing away my shot!&quot;', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_38935_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/29834"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Mark Herman fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_29834_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/32496"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Michael Rinella Fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_32496_0.png"></a></div>
</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#14</span><br /><br />If it were any other designer, I would say this is his magnum opus.  There is so much brilliance in this box, it is hard to believe that the box isn't the size of Fantasy Flight Coffin box.<br /><br />It takes cooperative-competitive to the ultimate level.  It is not King of the Hill, as many of these games try to be, and manages to simulate a war that is difficult to game.  It involves two teams each made up of two players.  The two teams fight it out while the two players on each team fight it out for the greatest glory.<br /><br />The 4-player nature of the game makes it difficult to get to the table, but if I could get these games, it will be interesting to see how this shakes out.  Right now, it's based on solo play.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: Not Ranked</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#13</span><br /><br />After all these years, it still remains the best (or 2nd best depending on who you talk to) game covering the entire Civil War.<br /><br />Like most Mark Herman games, the campaign is so great, that I don't like to play the scenarios.  The bad part of that, is that it is harder to get to the table, but it is oh so much more satisfying!<br /><br /><br /><b>Last Year: #15</b>

		</dl>
		<dl>
							<dd class="doubleleft">
									<div id='recommendstatus_listitem5334658'>
	<dl class="recommend">
			<dt class='recs'><a href="/login">12</a>&nbsp;</dt>
	<dd class='thumbdd'><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class="icon " src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==" alt="Thumb up" title="Thumb up"></a></dd>

			<dt class='tippers'><a href="/login" style='color: #969600;'></a></dt>
	<dd><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class='icon i_coinsmall2' title='GeekGold Tip' alt='tip' style=''  src='data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==' /></a></dd> 
			<dt class='thumbsdown'></dt>
	<dd><a href="/login" onmouseover="return overlib('Hide/Report this post', WRAP);" onmouseout="return nd();">&nbsp;<img class='icon i_redsquarex' title='Hide' alt='Hide' style=''  src='data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==' /></a></dd>
	</dl>
<div style='position:absolute;  z-index:2000;' id='recsure_listitem5334658'></div>						
</div>
								</dd>
						<dd class="doublecommands">
				<ul>
										<li id='recommendstatus_listitem5334658'>

			</a>

</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#12</span><br /><br />I have long wondered what IS Mike Rinella's greatest Area-Impulse game.  I think I found it.<br /><br />So why is this so special?  Every other Area-Impulse game I have consists of one side having a strength advantage and the other holding on until the clock runs out.  In this one, each side gets to do the butt-kicking.<br /><br />It plays in barely over an hour.  It is 3 turns long.  It has tons of decisions, a short rule book, small foot print.<br /><br />In short, it's everything you could want.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: Not Ranked</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>
		</dl>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#11</span><br /><br />This is my favorite 4-player free for all.  I prefer COIN as a solitaire game.  <a  href="/boardgame/199904/pericles-peloponnesian-wars"   >Pericles</a> is brilliant, but by definition isn't a free for all, and <a  href="/boardgame/36399/napoleonic-wars-second-edition"   >The Napoleonic Wars</a> is all against one.  <br /><br />This has that "gang up on the leader" aspect to keep it tight, and you have enforceable treaties, albeit temporary.  The sides have different strengths, abilities, and even decks.  The non-player activations are the final brilliant touch.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #9</b>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">

							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#10</span><br /><br />For the basketball junkie: this lets you study the chess match that is basketball coaching.  Individual player cards are rated in a variety of areas (passing in the half court and break, shooting and defense from the perimeter, drive, post, and fast break, rebounding on both ends of the floor, shot blocking, free throws, defense against the shot and on the ball).  You end up exploiting weaknesses and maximizing strengths, and working your roster to this end.<br /><br />You can replay games for simulation values or mix it up: I liked to play single-elimination NCAA-style tournaments.  I liked to have great teams in history play each other in a 7-game format.  All-star teams are fun, but draft leagues are the best.<br /><br />The baseball game is more elegant, but this game is the one I played more often.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #10</b>

		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>

	<span class='oddicon patron'></span><span class='oddicon year_10_band band' data-year='10'></span><span class='oddicon year_11_band band' data-year='11'></span><span class='oddicon year_12_band band' data-year='12'></span><span class='oddicon year_13_band band' data-year='13'></span><span class='oddicon year_14_num num last' data-year='14'></span>	</a>
</div>
		
	<div ><a href="/microbadge/1224"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Kansas State University', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_1224_0.gif"></a><a href="/microbadge/14733"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Washington\&#039;s War fan ', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_14733_1.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/38935"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('&quot;I am not throwing away my shot!&quot;', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_38935_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/29834"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Mark Herman fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_29834_0.png"></a><a href="/microbadge/32496"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover="return overlib('Michael Rinella Fan', WRAP );" onmouseout="return nd();" title=''src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw=="onload="lzld(this)"onerror="lzld(this)"class='mbimg'data-frz-src="//cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_32496_0.png"></a></div>
</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#7</span><br /><br /><div ><a href="/image/3540848"><img src="https://cf.geekdo-images.com/images/pic3540848.png" onload="ImageResizer.resize(this);"></a></div><br /><br />This is me -- or so it seems.<br /><br />This is a game I have been waiting for my whole life.  The Western Front of WWII from 1943 (Operation Husky) to the end is a tough topic as a whole.  How much fun can you have when Germany is constantly in retreat?  <a  href="/boardgame/78/westfront"   >WestFront</a> certainly couldn't pull it off.  This game does it.  How?  Through incorporating historical events, what ifs (you can try to invade France or Norway in 1943).  It forces the Allies to race the clock and beat the Soviets.  It gives both sides tough decisions involving your limited resources: for the Allies, it is air power and for the Axis it is protecting Italy and France.  Finally, it incorporates my favorite strategical mechanic: the Card Driven Game system.<br /><br />As an added bonus, it uses the <a  href="/boardgame/91/paths-glory"   >Paths of Glory</a> system without all of the fiddly rules and exceptions.  The game is easy to learn and tightly balanced.<br /><br />So why doesn't it get more love?  The map.  And you know what bugs me?  The map isn't THAT bad.  Yes, Mike Rinella has had games with better maps, such as <a  href="/boardgame/167650/last-battle-ie-shima-1945"   >Last Battle: Ie Shima, 1945</a>, but it is not fair to compare artists to Charles Kiebler (who made Last Battle).  Mike had no say so on this one.  The end result was functional and acceptable.  It's not going to hang framed on a wall, like a Rick Barber map, but it does not hinder game play with day-glo colors or confuse the user with ambiguities.  When the game was in development, the first draft of the map WAS atrocious.  This one was a 10-fold improvement.  It certainly is not enough to distract from an excellent game.<br /><br />What's not to love?  And don't say the map because Walter Sobchak is already on the edge.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #6</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl>
							<dd class="doubleleft">
									<div id='recommendstatus_listitem5334670'>
	<dl class="recommend">
			<dt class='recs'><a href="/login">10</a>&nbsp;</dt>
	<dd class='thumbdd'><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class="icon " src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==" alt="Thumb up" title="Thumb up"></a></dd>

			<dt class='tippers'><a href="/login" style='color: #969600;'>1.00</a></dt>
	<dd><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class='icon i_coinsmall2' title='GeekGold Tip' alt='tip' style=''  src='data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==' /></a></dd>

	<dd><a href="/login" onmouseover="return overlib('Hide/Report this post', WRAP);" onmouseout="return nd();">&nbsp;<img class='icon i_redsquarex' title='Hide' alt='Hide' style=''  src='data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==' /></a></dd>

Of course, I prefer clean, clear maps over pretty maps where I can&#039;t read anything.&lt;br \/&gt;&lt;br \/&gt;And I&#039;m digging the game so far (recently got my physical copy, played a bit solo, and now have two VASSAL PBEMs going).&lt;br \/&gt;&lt;br \/&gt;&quot;,&quot;avatar&quot;:&quot;&lt;div class=&#039;avatarblock js-avatar &#039; \/&gt;&lt;\/a&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;\/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\&quot;\/geekmail\/compose?touser=sushidog\&quot;&gt;&lt;img class=&#039;icon i_silk_email&#039; title=&#039;&#039; alt=&#039;msg&#039; 			</a>

</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#6</span><br /><br />This is Richard Borg's finest moment.  His Command & Colors system was perfected here.  This has a complexity level that shows all that this system can be.  You don't get some of the gaminess you get from Memoir and Battle Cry.  You move deliberately, slowly, and link up your lines and place your leaders just so.  You have lots of unit differentiation that makes you react to your cards.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #16</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl>
							<dd class="doubleleft">
									<div id='recommendstatus_listitem5334657'>
	<dl class="recommend">
			<dt class='recs'><a href="/login">13</a>&nbsp;</dt>
	<dd class='thumbdd'><a href="/login">&nbsp;<img class="icon " src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==" alt="Thumb up" title="Thumb up"></a></dd>

		<div class='comment_toolbar'>
			<span class='status' ng-show="loading">Loading...</span>

			<span class='sf mr5 b'>
				<ng-pluralize count="data.config.numitems"
								  when="{'0':     'No Comments',
								         'one':   '1 Comment',
											'other': '{} Comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked"> | Locked</span>
			</span>

			<span ng-show="data.config.numitems > 0">
				<a ng-hide="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = true">Hide</a>
				<a ng-show="hidecomments" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="hidecomments = false">Show</a>
			</span>

			<a ng-if="showadmincontrols" class="comment_button" ng-href="" ng-click="toggleLock()">
				<span ng-if="data.config.locked">Unlock</span>
				<span ng-if="!data.config.locked">Lock</span>
			</a>

			<a ng-if="showCommentButton()"
				class="comment_button js-quickcomment"
				data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}"
				data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}">Comment</a>

			<span
				ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
				class='sf error'>
				&nbsp;<ng-pluralize count="numprevitems_calculated"
					when="{ 'one' : '1 previous comment',
					        'other': '{} previous comments'}">
				</ng-pluralize>&nbsp;
			</span>

			<span
					class="comment_button"
					ng-show="numprevitems_calculated"
					ng-click="loadMoreComments('previous')">
						View Previous
							{{limitCount(numprevitems_calculated,commentParams.showcount)}}
			</span>

			<span class="fr" ng-show="showpager">
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageToFirst( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">1</span>
				<span class="comment_button" ng-click="pageBackward( $event )" ng-hide="commentParams.pageid==1">&laquo;</span>
				Pg. {{commentParams.pageid}}
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageForward( $event )">&raquo;</span>
				<span  ng-class="getCommentButtonClass()" ng-click="pageToLast( $event )">{{data.config.endpage}}</span>
			</span>

			<div class="clear"></div>
		</div>

		<div class="errorbox" ng-if="error">
			{{error.message}}
		</div>

		<div id='quickcomment_{{commentParams.objecttype}}_{{commentParams.objectid}}'></div>

		<div ng-hide="hidecomments">

			<div id="comment{{comment.commentid}}"
				  ng-class="applyStyle( comment )"
				  ng-repeat="comment in data.comments"
				  ng-init="comment.visible = !comment.hidden && !comment.blocked">
				<a name="comment{{comment.commentid}}"></a>
				<dl class="commentbody" id="body_comment{{comment.commentid}}" ng-show="comment.visible">
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.avatar"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="right">
						<div class='article_subject sf' ng-if="0">
							<span ng-bind-html="data.config.objectlink"></span>
						</div>
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.body"></span>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<dl>
					<dd class="left">
						<span ng-bind-html="comment.recommend"></span>
					</dd>
					<dd class="commands">
						<ul>
							<li id="objstatus_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
								<span ng-if="comment.hidden || comment.blocked">
									[<a ng-click="comment.visible = !comment.visible" ng-switch on="comment.visible"><span ng-switch-when="false">Show</span><span ng-switch-when="true">Hide</span><span ng-switch-default></span></a>]
								</span>
								<span ng-if="comment.thumbvalue==4" class="ml10">
									Thank you for helping us moderate the site. [<a href="/community_rules">Community Rules</a>]
								</span>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<ul class="information" id="controls_comment{{comment.commentid}}">
							<li ng-if="comment.editdate_formatted">
								Edited <span ng-bind-html="comment.editdate_formatted"></span>
							</li>
							<li>
								<a ng-href="/{{comment.objecttype}}/{{comment.objectid}}?commentid={{comment.commentid}}#comment{{comment.commentid}}">Posted <span ng-bind-html="comment.postdate_formatted"></span></a>
							</li>
							<li>
								<ul class="commands" ng-show="comment.visible">
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}">Reply</a>
									</li>
									<li>
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-quote="1">Quote</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showEditControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button js-quickcomment" data-objecttype="{{commentParams.objecttype}}" data-objectid="{{commentParams.objectid}}" data-commentid="{{comment.commentid}}" data-edit="1">Edit</a>
									</li>
									<li ng-if="showDeleteControls( comment.userid )">
										<a class="comment_button" ng-href="/comment/delete/{{comment.commentid}}">Delete</a>
									</li>
								</ul>
								<div class="clear"></div>
							</li>
						</ul>
						<div class='clear'></div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
				<div class="clear"></div>
				<div class="errorbox" ng-if="comment.error">{{comment.error.message}}</div>
				<div id='quickcomment_{{comment.objecttype}}_{{comment.objectid}}_{{comment.commentid}}'></div>
			</div>
		</div>

</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#5</span><br /><br />This entry is for the Band of Brothers series, because I enjoy Ghost Panzer, Screaming Eagles, and Texas Arrows equally and really have a hard differentiating them (plus, it allows me to squeeze in another game on this list: busted!)<br /><br />This game is the slayer of wargames.  And by that, I mean, I just gave up on numerous games: Conflict of Heroes, Squad Leader, Advanced Squad Leader,  LnL Band of Heroes, Tide of Iron, Combat Commander, Panzer Grenadier...<br /><br />This is how small unit tactics are meant to be played.  (Yeah, yeah, PG is Platoon-level: I know, but it is tactical).  This is the most realistic tactical WWII system out there.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #4</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>

											</div>

			</div>
			<dd class="doubleleft"><a   href="/image/937167/shifting-sands" ><img  style=" width:118px; height:150px; "   src="https://cf.geekdo-images.com/images/pic937167_t.jpg"></a></dd>
							<dd class="left" style="clear:none;"><div class='avatarblock js-avatar divcenter' data-userid='189519' data-username='airjudden' data-urlusername='airjudden'> 
	<div>Judd Vance</div>
	<div class='username'>(<a href="/user/airjudden">airjudden</a>)</div>
	
	<div class='location js-location'>United States<br>Wichita<br>Kansas</div>

</div>
</dd>
						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#4</span><br /><br />Here's the funny thing: Mike Rinella is the master of Area-Impulse games.  But this remains my favorite game by him.  Is it because it was the first game I played by him?  Don't know.  I just know he took the <a  href="/boardgame/91/paths-glory"   >Paths of Glory</a> system and made it better. It is just a very tense game for both sides for the entire game.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #5</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
			</dd>

						<dd class="doubleright">
									<span style="font-size: 24pt;">#3</span><br /><br />Perfection.<br /><br />That is all I need to say about this game.  This is the greatest accomplishment from the greatest designer in the history of gaming, and believe me, he has made a BUNCH of masterpieces.  Winning a game of this is the most satisfying gaming experience of my life.  If I weren't so stubborn and insist on playing the entire campaign, I would play this at least twice a year and this would be #1 on the list.  Instead, I play it less frequently, but those marathons are worth it.<br /><br /><b>Last Year: #3</b>
								<div class='clear'></div>
